alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dewey; Hughes; Hyde; Jones; Lyman; Potter; Stanley; Sully (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 8:22PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT JONES...SULLY...HYDE...SOUTHERN POTTER...STANLEY...SOUTHEASTERN DEWEY...HUGHES...LYMAN AND WESTERN BUFFALO COUNTIES THROUGH 1000 PM CDT/900 PM MDT/... At 921 PM CDT/821 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over portions of central South Dakota, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pierre, Fort Pierre, Fort Thompson, Gettysburg, Highmore, Lower Brule, Onida, Presho, Murdo, Oacoma, Blunt, Kennebec, Spring Creek Rec Area, Reliance, Vivian, Harrold, Swiftbird, Draper, Agar, and Stephan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Aberdeen. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT/1000 PM MDT/ for north central South Dakota.
